page.title: 09DUNDEE - CROP TECHNOLOGY
page.content: A Third World crop,{CASSAVA,}is under investigation by the Virology Department funded by the Overseas Development Administration. The most expensive items in the laboratories are electron microscopes of which they have three,the newest costing Â£110,000. The institute has 30 micro-computers and access to the Edinburgh Regional Computer Centre by telephone. Relationships with other countries are good as politics do not come into scientific work and scientists can go from country to country with very little difficulty.For instance in 1985 a Doctor of Science from U.S.S.R. is coming to Mylnefield. Children are employed as berry-pickers during their summer holidays from school.
